title: Two dimensional quantum central limit theorem by quantum walks
authors: Keisuke Asahara, Daiju Funakawa, Motoki Seki, Akito Suzuki
abstract:
Quantum walks, mathematical models referred to as the quantum counterparts of
random walks, have garnered significant attention in recent years with the
advancement of quantum computing. The weak limit theorem for quantum walks,
analogous to the central limit theorem for random walks, is one of the most
important theorems in this field. In this study, we investigated the weak limit
theorem for a two-state discrete-time quantum walk on a two-dimensional square
lattice. As a result, we derived a two-dimensional probability distribution
whose support is the intersection of two ellipses. The probability distribution
we obtained resembles the distribution of one-dimensional quantum walks while
possessing a unique form specific to two dimensions.
